isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION, TANDEM AXLE: INTERNATIONAL - ASSEMBLE - DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: If ring gear was removed from differential case, reinstall at this time. Clean mating surfaces and bolt ring gear to differential case at 3 locations 120° apart to help eliminate ring gear runout. Use hydraulic press and suitable riveting fixture, as shown. Pressure requirement per rivet is 45 to 50 U.S. tons (41 to 45 metric tons).
The ring gear is properly installed when a .0015 (.038 mm) feeler gauge cannot be inserted between the differential case flange and the ring gear backface ( Figure 38).

note.para: Ring gear and pinion must be replaced as a matched set only.

step1.para: Install bearing cones to differential case halves. Place bearing cups on cones during remainder of assembly to prevent damage to bearings.

note.para: Use of press and proper adapter is required to eliminate possible damage to bearings.

step1.para: Apply a small amount of lubricant to all mating surfaces. This will keep thrust washers in place during assembly and provide initial lubrication.
Place thrust washer and side gear in flange half differential case. Dimples in thrust washers go against side gear.
Assemble differential pinions and thrust washers on cross shaft. Place assembly in flange half differential case.
Place remaining side gear and thrust washers in position on differential pinions.
Assemble case halves, making sure match marks are lined up.
Install differential case bolts. Tighten alternately and evenly. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
